docs.text: Welcome Hello and welcome to my Home Assistant configuration. Thank you for stopping and checking it out. My configuration has moved from running on raspbian to HassIO and finally running under docker on the Intel Nuc. Bits and Bobs Device Source Image Device Source Image Raspberry PI III - running hassio Element14.com https://github.com/cy1701/Home-Assistant-Configuration/blob/master/readme_images/raspberry-pi-3.png" width="200"/ Wemo mini switches Amazon.com Phillips hue bulbs gen 1 & 2 Best Buy Ecobee 4 Thermostat w/Room Sensors Amazon Google Home Hub Google Mini Various Google Chromcast audio Walmart Roku Mini Amazon Kodi Players Automations Lower the lights when Kodi is playing Low temp notification for basement (broken after move it the NUC) Nightlight mode for ceiling lights in kitchen and hall Weekly backup service call DIY Projects | | Floating Crystal Tower This project was based on https://youtu.be/Jh618yi0JZY by DIY Perks. For mine I replaced the individual led channels with an esp8266 controller first running code for standalone wifi device now HA integrated. The configuration for ESPHome is located in /sanitized_ESPHome/tower.yaml| Full build will be added on my .io site. Retired Technologies Device Reason Wink spotter probes Stopped talking DIRECTV receiver Cut the cord Wink PowerPivot Genius Went offline randomly LimitlessLED bulbs (did not want to invest in new bridge. I might pull these back out if I build the ESP8266 milight contoller project.)
